ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No indeed! Truly man is unbridled
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And yet, but yet man is rebellious,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Despite this, the human being still tends to rebel
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Yes indeed, man is surely rebellious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nay! man is most surely inordinate,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: No indeed; surely Man waxes insolent,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay, but verily man is rebellious
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By no means: Verily man exorbitateth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nay, but man doth transgress all bounds,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nay! Verily, man does transgress all bounds (in disbelief and evil deed, etc.).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Indeed, surely the human is very insolent
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: In fact, man oversteps all bounds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [96:6] Nay, but verily man is [wont to be] rebellious,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nay, but verily) Muhammad (man) i.e. the disbeliever (is rebellious) is a wanton, he moves from one position to another with regard to his food, drink, clothing and mount
